intro: Peucedanum salsugineum, commonly known as the Mediterranean cow parsley, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that appear in umbels. Native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia, it thrives in rocky or calcareous soils. The plant is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. Its aromatic foliage and showy flowers make it a notable species in botanical studies and horticulture.
